Package me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.inventory

Class PaginatedInventory<T extends PaginatedInventory<T>>

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.inventory.CustomInventory<T>
me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.inventory.PaginatedInventory<T>
Type Parameters:
T - A type that extends PaginatedInventory, this type will be returned for builder purposes.
Direct Known Subclasses:
SingleInventory
public abstract class PaginatedInventory<T extends PaginatedInventory<T>> extends CustomInventory<T>
Abstract class that implements generic functionality for paginated inventories.

  • Constructor Details

    • PaginatedInventory

      protected PaginatedInventory(int size, String name)
      Creates a new PaginatedInventory with the provided size and name. The size must be a multiple of 9, no greater than 54 and no less than 9. The name will automatically have any colors translated, including HEX colors. For example: "&bInventory #;ffffffName" would result in "Inventory" being aqua, and "Name" being white.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the inventory.
      name - The name of the inventory.

    • isHideInvalidButton

      public boolean isHideInvalidButton()
      Returns if buttons will be hidden if they are "invalid". The next button will be invalid if there isn't a next page. The back button will be invalid if the current page is the first page.
      Returns:
      If the buttons should be hidden.

    • setHideInvalidButton

      public T setHideInvalidButton(boolean hideInvalidButton)
      Sets if buttons will be hidden if they are "invalid". The next button will be invalid if there isn't a next page. The back button will be invalid if the current page is the first page.
      Parameters:
      hideInvalidButton - If the buttons should be hidden when invalid.
      Returns:
      The caller PaginatedInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • getPages

      public List<PaginatedInventory<?>> getPages()
      Returns:
      The list of pages this inventory is holding.

    • addPage

      public T addPage(PaginatedInventory<T> builder)
      Adds a PaginatedInventory as a page to this PaginatedInventory Page arrows will automatically be set on the bottom corner slots.
      Parameters:
      builder - The builder to add.
      Returns:
      The caller PaginatedInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • addItemsAndPages

      public T addItemsAndPages(List<ItemBuilder> items, Supplier<PaginatedInventory<T>> supplier)
      Adds ALL items into the CustomInventory. If the current page is full, the CustomInventory will be copied and items will begin to be placed there.
      Parameters:
      items - A list of ItemBuilders to place into the inventory
      supplier - A supplier that should return a PaginatedInventory. This Supplier will be used when a new Page needs to be added, and the supplied inventory will be added as a page.
      Returns:
      The caller PaginatedInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • getPage

      public PaginatedInventory<?> getPage(int page)
      Parameters:
      page - The page to get
      Returns:
      The PaginatedInventory at that page index

    • setPageArrows

      public T setPageArrows()
      Forcefully places page arrows into an Inventory
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • onPageChange

      public T onPageChange(BiConsumer<org.bukkit.entity.Player,PaginatedInventory<?>> consumer)
      Called when the Inventory's page changes.
      Parameters:
      consumer - A BiFunction containing the Player that changed the page and the new page.
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • nextPage

      public void nextPage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Goes to the next page, if it exists, for this player.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to advance the page for.

    • previousPage

      public void previousPage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Goes to the previous page, if it exists, for this player.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to backtrack the page for.

    • getPageChange

      protected BiConsumer<org.bukkit.entity.Player,PaginatedInventory<?>> getPageChange()
      Returns:
      The BiConsumer that is consumed when the page is changed.
